global_attributes.Conventions: Esri conventions as given in 'ESRI Shapefile Technical Description, an ESRI White Paper, July 1998' http://www.esri.com/library/whitepapers/pdfs/shapefile.pdf
global_attributes.title: Level 2 KaRIn High Rate River Single Pass Vector Product - Reach

reach_id.long_name: reach ID from prior river database
reach_id.comment: Unique reach identifier from the prior river database. The format of the identifier is CBBBBBRRRRT, where C=continent, B=basin, R=reach, T=type.

time.tai_utc_difference: [value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]
time.comment: Time of measurement in seconds in the UTC time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 UTC. [tai_utc_difference] is the difference between TAI and UTC reference time (seconds) for the first measurement of the data set. If a leap second occurs within the data set, the metadata leap_second is set to the UTC time at which the leap second occurs.

time_tai.comment: Time of measurement in seconds in the TAI time scale since 1 Jan 2000 00:00:00 TAI. This time scale contains no leap seconds. The difference (in seconds) with time in UTC is given by the metadata [time:tai_utc_difference].

time_str.tai_utc_difference: [value of TAI-UTC at time of first record]
time_str.comment: Time string giving UTC time. The format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ, where the Z suffix indicates UTC time.

p_lat.long_name: latitude of the center of the reach
p_lat.comment: Geodetic latitude of the reach center from the prior river database. Positive values increase northward of the equator.

p_lon.long_name: longitude of the center of the reach
p_lon.comment: Geodetic longitude of the reach center from the prior river database. The longitude values become more positive to the east and more negative to the west of the Prime Meridian.

river_name.comment: English language name(s) of the river from the prior river database, which adapts the name(s) from Open Street Map. If there are multiple names, they are separated by a forward slash.

wse.long_name: water surface elevation with respect to the geoid
wse.comment: Fitted reach water surface elevation, relative to the provided model of the geoid (geoid_hght), with corrections for media delays (wet and dry troposphere, and ionosphere), crossover correction, and tidal effects (solid_tide, load_tidef, and pole_tide) applied.

wse_u.long_name: total uncertainty in the water surface elevation
wse_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the reach WSE, including uncertainties of corrections, and variation about the fit.

wse_r_u.long_name: random-only uncertainty in the water surface elevation
wse_r_u.comment: Random-only component of the uncertainty in the reach WSE, including uncertainties of corrections, and variation about the fit.

wse_c.long_name: constrained water surface elevation with respect to the geoid
wse_c.comment: Constrained water surface elevation, relative to the provided model of the geoid (geoid_hght), with corrections for media delays (wet and dry troposphere, and ionosphere), crossover correction, and tidal effects (solid_tide, load_tidef, and pole_tide) applied. This estimate of the water surface elevation is constrained to follow a predefined monotonic relationship with the river width.

wse_c_u.long_name: total uncertainty in the constrained water surface elevation
wse_c_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the constrained reach WSE, including uncertainties of corrections, and variation about the fit..

slope.long_name: water surface slope with respect to the geoid
slope.comment: Fitted water surface slope relative to the geoid, and with the same corrections and geophysical fields applied as wse. The units are m/m. The upstream or downstream direction is defined by the prior river database. A positive slope means that the downstream WSE is lower.

slope_u.long_name: total uncertainty in the water surface slope
slope_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the water surface slope, including uncertainties of corrections and variation about the fit.

slope_r_u.long_name: random uncertainty in the water surface slope
slope_r_u.comment: Random-only component of the uncertainty in the water surface slope.

slope2.long_name: enhanced water surface slope with respect to the geoid
slope2.comment: Enhanced water surface slope relative to the geoid, produced using a smoothing of the node wse. The upstream or downstream direction is defined by the prior river database. A positive slope means that the downstream WSE is lower.

slope2_u.long_name: uncertainty in the enhanced water surface slope
slope2_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty (random and systematic) in the enhanced water surface slope, including uncertainties of corrections and variation about the fit.

slope2_r_u.long_name: random uncertainty in the enhanced water surface slope
slope2_r_u.comment: Random-only component of the uncertainty in the enhanced water surface slope.

width_u.long_name: total uncertainty in the reach width
width_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty in the reach width.

width_c.comment: Constrained reach width. This estimate of the width is constrained to follow a predefined monotonic relationship with the WSE.

width_c_u.long_name: total uncertainty in the constrained reach width
width_c_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty in the constrained reach width.

area_total.long_name: total water surface area including dark water
area_total.comment: Total estimated water surface area, including dark water that was not detected as water in the SWOT observation but identified through the use of a prior water likelihood map.

area_tot_u.long_name: uncertainty in the total water surface area
area_tot_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty in the total estimated water surface area area_total.

area_detct.long_name: surface area of detected water pixels
area_detct.comment: Surface area of reach that was detected as water by the SWOT observation.

area_det_u.long_name: uncertainty in the surface area of detected water
area_det_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty in the surface area of the detected water pixels.

area_wse.long_name: area used to compute water surface elevation
area_wse.comment: Surface area of the reach that contributed to the computation of the WSE.

d_x_area.comment: Change in channel cross sectional area from the value reported in the prior river database.

d_x_area_u.long_name: total uncertainty of the change in the cross-sectional area
d_x_area_u.comment: Total one-sigma uncertainty in the change in the cross-sectional area.

layovr_val.comment: Estimate of the systematic error in WSE due to layover.

node_dist.long_name: mean distance between observed and prior river database node locations
node_dist.comment: Mean distance between the observed node locations and the node locations in the prior river database.

loc_offset.long_name: along-stream location offset between the observed and prior reach location
loc_offset.comment: Location offset between the observed and prior reach locations. This is defined as the mean of the along-stream node distances of only observed nodes in the reach, minus the mean of all prior river database along-stream node distances in the reach.

xtrk_dist.long_name: distance to the satellite ground track
xtrk_dist.comment: Average distance of the observed node locations in the reach from the spacecraft nadir track. A negative value indicates the left side of the swath, relative to the spacecraft velocity vector. A positive value indicates the right side of the swath.

dschg_c.comment: Discharge from the consensus discharge algorithm.

dschg_c_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the consensus algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_csf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in consensus discharge
dschg_csf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the consensus algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_c_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the consensus discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the consensus discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_gc.comment: Discharge from the gauge-constrained consensus discharge algorithm.

dschg_gc_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained consensus algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_gcsf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in gauge-constrained consensus discharge
dschg_gcsf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained consensus algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_gc_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the gauge-constrained consensus discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the gauge-constrained consensus discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_m.comment: Discharge from the MetroMan discharge algorithm.

dschg_m_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the MetroMan algorithm as an absolute quanitty.

dschg_msf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in MetroMan discharge
dschg_msf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the MetroMan algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_m_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the MetroMan discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the MetroMan discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_gm.comment: Discharge from the gauge-constrained MetroMan discharge algorithm.

dschg_gm_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained MetroMan algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_gmsf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in gauge-constrained MetroMan discharge
dschg_gmsf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained MetroMan algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_gm_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the gauge-constrained MetroMan discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the gauge-constrained MetroMan discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_b.comment: Discharge from the BAM discharge algorithm.

dschg_b_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the BAM algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_bsf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in BAM discharge
dschg_bsf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the BAM algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_b_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the BAM discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the BAM discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_gb.comment: Discharge from the gauge-constrained BAM discharge algorithm.

dschg_gb_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained BAM algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_gbsf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in gauge-constrained BAM discharge
dschg_gbsf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained BAM algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_gb_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the gauge-constrained BAM discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the gauge-constrained BAM discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_h.comment: Discharge from the HiVDI discharge algorithm.

dschg_h_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the HiVDI algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_hsf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in HiVDI discharge
dschg_hsf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the HiVDI algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_h_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the HiVDI discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the HiVDI discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_gh.comment: Discharge from the gauge-constrained HiVDI discharge algorithm.

dschg_gh_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained HiVDI algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_ghsf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in gauge-constrained HiVDI discharge
dschg_ghsf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained HiVDI algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_gh_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the gauge-constrained HiVDI discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the gauge-constrained HiVDI discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_o.comment: Discharge from the MOMMA discharge algorithm.

dschg_o_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the MOMMA algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_osf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in MOMMA discharge
dschg_osf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the MOMMA algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_o_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the MOMMA discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the MOMMA discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_go.comment: Discharge from the gauge-constrained MOMMA discharge algorithm.

dschg_go_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained MOMMA algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_gosf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in gauge-constrained MOMMA discharge
dschg_gosf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained MOMMA algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_go_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the gauge-constrained MOMMA discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the gauge-constrained MOMMA discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_s.comment: Discharge from the SADS discharge algorithm.

dschg_s_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the SADS algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_ssf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in SADS discharge
dschg_ssf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the SADS algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_s_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the SADS discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the SADS discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_gs.comment: Discharge from the gauge-constrained SADS discharge algorithm.

dschg_gs_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained SADS algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_gssf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in gauge-constrained SADS discharge
dschg_gssf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained SADS algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_gs_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the gauge-constrained SADS discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the gauge-constrained SADS discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_i.comment: Discharge from the SIC4DVar discharge algorithm.

dschg_i_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the SIC4DVar algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_isf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in SIC4DVar discharge
dschg_isf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the SIC4DVar algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_i_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the SIC4DVar discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the SIC4DVar discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_gi.comment: Discharge from the gauge-constrained SIC4DVar discharge algorithm.

dschg_gi_u.comment: Total uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained SIC4DVar algorithm as an absolute quantity.

dschg_gisf.long_name: fractional systematic uncertainty in gauge-constrained SIC4DVar discharge
dschg_gisf.comment: Systematic component of the uncertainty in the discharge from the gauge-constrained SIC4DVar algorithm as a fractional quantity.

dschg_gi_q.comment: Flag that indicates quality of the gauge-constrained SIC4DVar discharge. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the gauge-constrained SIC4DVar discharge is valid, questionable, and invalid, respectively.

dschg_q_b.flag_meanings: reach_qual_suspect big_slope_unc metro_dxa_bad bam_dxa_bad hivdi_dxa_bad momma_b_gt_momma_h sads_dxa_bad sic4dvar_dxa_bad incomplete_consensus reach_qual_degraded reach_qual_bad no_discharge_outputs negative_slope
dschg_q_b.comment: Bitwise quality indicator for the consensus discharge measurement. If this word is interpreted as an unsigned integer, a value of 0 indicates good data, values greater than 0 but less than 262144 represent suspect data, values greater than or equal to 262144 but less than 4194304 represent degraded data, and values greater than or equal to 4194304 represent bad data.

dschg_gq_b.long_name: bitwise quality indicator for gauge-constrained discharge
dschg_gq_b.flag_meanings: reach_qual_suspect big_slope_unc metro_dxa_bad bam_dxa_bad hivdi_dxa_bad momma_b_gt_momma_h sads_dxa_bad sic4dvar_dxa_bad incomplete_consensus reach_qual_degraded reach_qual_bad no_discharge_outputs negative_slope
dschg_gq_b.comment: Bitwise quality indicator for the gauge-constrained consensus discharge measurement. If this word is interpreted as an unsigned integer, a value of 0 indicates good data, values greater than 0 but less than 262144 represent suspect data, values greater than or equal to 262144 but less than 4194304 represent degraded data, and values greater than or equal to 4194304 represent bad data.

reach_q.long_name: summary quality indicator for the reach
reach_q.comment: Summary quality indicator for the reach measurement. A value of 0 indicates a nominal measurement, 1 indicates a suspect measurement, 2 indicates a degraded measurement, and 3 indicates a bad measurement.

reach_q_b.long_name: bitwise quality indicator for the reach
reach_q_b.flag_meanings: classification_qual_suspect geolocation_qual_suspect water_fraction_suspect bright_land few_area_observations few_wse_observations far_range_suspect near_range_suspect partially_observed classification_qual_degraded geolocation_qual_degraded lake_flagged below_min_fit_points no_area_observations no_wse_observations no_observations
reach_q_b.comment: Bitwise quality indicator for the reach measurements. If this word is interpreted as an unsigned integer, a value of 0 indicates good data, values greater than 0 but less than 262144 represent suspect data, values greater than or equal to 262144 but less than 4194304 represent degraded data, and values greater than or equal to 4194304 represent bad data.

dark_frac.comment: Fraction of the measured reach area covered by dark water.

ice_clim_f.comment: Climatological ice cover flag indicating whether the reach is ice-covered on the day of the observation based on external climatological information (not the SWOT measurement). Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the reach is likely not ice covered, may or may not be partially or fully ice covered, and likely fully ice covered, respectively.

ice_dyn_f.comment: Dynamic ice cover flag indicating whether the surface is ice-covered on the day of the observation based on analysis of external satellite optical data. Values of 0, 1, and 2 indicate that the reach is not ice covered, partially ice covered, and fully ice covered, respectively.

partial_f.comment: Flag that indicates only partial reach coverage. The flag is 0 if at least half the nodes of the reach have valid WSE measurements; the flag is 1 otherwise and reach-level quantities are not computed.

n_good_nod.long_name: number of nodes in the reach that have a valid WSE
n_good_nod.comment: Number of nodes in the reach that have a valid node WSE. Note that the total number of nodes from the prior river database is given by p_n_nodes.

obs_frac_n.long_name: fraction of nodes that have a valid WSE
obs_frac_n.comment: Fraction of nodes (n_good_nod/p_n_nodes) in the reach that have a valid node WSE. The value is between 0 and 1.

xovr_cal_q.comment: Quality of the cross-over calibration. A value of 0 indicates a nominal measurement, 1 indicates a suspect measurement, and 2 indicates a bad measurement.

geoid_hght.comment: Geoid height above the reference ellipsoid with a correction to refer the value to the mean tide system i.e., includes the permanent tide (zero frequency).

geoid_slop.comment: Geoid slope in the along-stream direction, based upon a least-square linear fit along the reach. A positive slope means that the downstream geoid model height is lower.

solid_tide.source: Cartwright and Taylor (1971) and Cartwright and Edden (1973)
solid_tide.comment: Solid-Earth (body) tide height. The zero-frequency permanent tide component is not included.

load_tidef.comment: Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust. This value is used to compute wse.

load_tideg.comment: Geocentric load tide height. The effect of the ocean tide loading of the Earth's crust.

pole_tide.comment: Geocentric pole tide height. The sum total of the contribution from the solid-Earth (body) pole tide height and the load pole tide height (i.e., the effect of the ocean pole tide loading of the Earth's crust).

dry_trop_c.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
dry_trop_c.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to dry troposphere delay. Adding the reported correction to the reported reach WSE results in the uncorrected reach WSE.

wet_trop_c.source: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
wet_trop_c.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to wet troposphere delay. Adding the reported correction to the reported reach WSE results in the uncorrected reach WSE.

iono_c.comment: Equivalent vertical correction due to ionosphere delay. Adding the reported correction to the reported reach WSE results in the uncorrected reach WSE.

xovr_cal_c.comment: Height correction from KaRIn crossover calibration. The correction is applied before geolocation but reported as an equivalent height correction.

n_reach_up.comment: Number of upstream reaches, from the prior river database. A value of 4 indicates 4 or more upstream reaches.

n_reach_dn.comment: Number of downstream reaches, from the prior river database. A value of 4 indicates 4 or more downstream reaches.

rch_id_up.comment: Values of reach_id for the upstream reaches, from the prior river database. The values are strings of comma-separated lists of at most 4 reach identifiers corresponding to the upstream reaches.

rch_id_dn.comment: Values of reach_id for the downstream reaches, from the prior river database. The values are strings of comma-separated lists of at most 4 reach identifiers corresponding to the downstream reaches.

p_wse.comment: Reach WSE from the prior river database.

p_wse_var.comment: Reach WSE spatial variability from the prior river database.

p_width.comment: Reach width from the prior river database.

p_wid_var.comment: Reach width spatial variability from the prior river database.

p_n_nodes.long_name: number of nodes in the reach
p_n_nodes.comment: Number of nodes in the reach from the prior river database.

p_dist_out.long_name: distance from the reach to the outlet
p_dist_out.comment: Along-stream distance from the reach center to the outlet, from the prior river database.

p_length.comment: Length of the reach from the prior river database.

p_maf.comment: Mean annual flow from the prior river database.

p_dam_id.comment: Dam ID from the Global Reservoir and Dam (GRanD) database. The value is 0 if there is no influence of dams along the reach, and a positive value indicates there is an influence of a dam along the reach. The value of grand_id identifies the dam ID in the GRanD database. Reaches influenced by dams are indicated by the type code in reach_id.

p_n_ch_max.long_name: maximum number of channels detected in the reach
p_n_ch_max.comment: Maximum number of channels in the reach from the prior river database.

p_n_ch_mod.long_name: mode of the number of channels in the reach
p_n_ch_mod.comment: Mode of the number of channels in the reach from the prior river database.

p_low_slp.comment: Low-slope flag from the prior river database. A nonzero value indicates that the reach slope is considered to be low. Low-slope reaches are handled differently than other reaches by the MetroMan discharge algorithm.
